thread.title: Screaming hotel guest threatens to 'detonate a bomb' at Trump Tower
thread.title_full: Screaming hotel guest threatens to 'detonate a bomb' at Trump Tower

title: Screaming hotel guest threatens to 'detonate a bomb' at Trump Tower
text:
Screaming hotel guest threatens to 'detonate a bomb' at Trump Tower Screaming hotel guest threatens to 'detonate a bomb' at Trump Tower A SCREAMING man threatened to detonate a bomb inside Donald Trump's hotel and office block. PUBLISHED: 20:35, Fri, Feb 24, 2017 | UPDATED: 21:57, Fri, Feb 24, 2017 
Police rushed to the US President's Trump International Hotel and Tower in Chicago on Friday afternoon after a "disturbance call" was made from the building, police said. 
Officers would not confirm a bomb threat was made. 
However, a resident of the 401 N. Wabash Avenue tower said a man was screaming outside and threatened to detonate a bomb. NC A man was seen screaming about detonating a bomb outside Trump Tower in Chicago 
Police confirmed they had taken a man into custody. 
At 1.45pm, five Chicago Police vans were seen outside the tower's entrance. Related articles Donald Trump lauded for double down over Sweden attack claim at CPAC 
Dogs from the force's K-9 unit were also seen going into the building. 
Audio from the police radio dispatch revealed the man checked in on Friday morning and had a bomb in his room. Getty The man was staying in the Trump Hotel in Chicago 
The dispatcher, said: "I have a bomb threat, 401 North Wabash. 
"A male checked in this morning and said that he has a bomb inside of his room." 
Police Superintendent Eddie Johnson told reporters at an unrelated press conference the man was "mentally challenged" and taken to the hospital for evaluation. Related articles
